Version:
1.0
Author:

Field Summary
 java.lang.String certificateManagers
          Certificates implementation used in SSL authentication.
Used to create the KeyManagers and TrustManagers that determine, respectively, the certificate sent in authentication and if the certificate received is accepted.

          Enabled ciphers used in SSL.
See JSSE documentation

          Protocol used in secure communication.

Field Detail

protocol

public java.lang.String protocol
Protocol used in secure communication. Ex: "SSL", "TLS"

certificateManagers

public java.lang.String certificateManagers
Certificates implementation used in SSL authentication.
Used to create the KeyManagers and TrustManagers that determine, respectively, the certificate sent in authentication and if the certificate received is accepted.

keyStore

public java.lang.String keyStore
KeyStore, format used to store the keys. Ex: "JKS"

keystoreFile

public java.lang.String keystoreFile
Name of the file were the certificates are stored. The identity certificate sent in authentication, and the recognized/trusted certificates used to authenticate the peer must be in the file. Required for peer authentication.

passphrase

public char[] passphrase
Passphrase to access the file where the certificate is stored.

enabledCiphers

public java.lang.String[] enabledCiphers
Enabled ciphers used in SSL.
See JSSE documentation

Constructor Detail

SslRegisterSocketEvent

public SslRegisterSocketEvent(Channel channel,
                              int dir,
                              Session source)
                       throws AppiaEventException
Creates a SslRegisterSocketEvent with first available port. After a port is assigned the event is sent upwards.

Parameters:
channel - The Channel where the event will flow
dir - The direction of the event
source - The session generating the event
Throws:
AppiaEventException

SslRegisterSocketEvent

public SslRegisterSocketEvent(Channel channel,
                              int dir,
                              Session source,
                              int port)
                       throws AppiaEventException
Creates a SslRegisterSocketEvent with the given port. After a port is assigned the event is sent upwards.

Parameters:
channel - The Channel where the event will flow
dir - The direction of the event
source - The session generating the event
port - The port number that will be binded to the UdpSimpleSession
Throws:
AppiaEventException

SslRegisterSocketEvent

public SslRegisterSocketEvent(Channel channel,
                              int dir,
                              Session source,
                              java.lang.String certsFile,
                              char[] passphrase)
                       throws AppiaEventException
Creates a SslRegisterSocketEvent with first available port. After a port is assigned the event is sent upwards. Depending on the ciphers used peer authentication may be enabled.

Parameters:
channel - The Channel where the event will flow
dir - The direction of the event
source - The session generating the event
certsFile - The file where the certificates used for peer authentication are stored.
passphrase - The passphase to access the certificate file.
Throws:
AppiaEventException

SslRegisterSocketEvent

public SslRegisterSocketEvent(Channel channel,
                              int dir,
                              Session source,
                              int port,
                              java.lang.String certsFile,
                              char[] passphrase)
                       throws AppiaEventException
Creates a SslRegisterSocketEvent with the given port. After a port is assigned the event is sent upwards. Depending on the ciphers used peer authentication may be enabled.

Parameters:
channel - The Channel where the event will flow
dir - The direction of the event
source - The session generating the event
port - The port number that will be binded
certsFile - The file where the certificates used for peer authentication are stored.
passphrase - The passphase to access the certificate file.
Throws:
AppiaEventException
